to the date of arrival for this hotel but then the hotelcharges you the whole amount on the day of reservation and tells you that it will take 30 days to get your money back!!!!! That's definetely not a room with free cancellation, very misleading!!!!

title: The best experience with The Washington Hotel
text:
This hotel is in a great location . We had a corner room with big windows looking out at the World Trade Center. 
The front staff are all so nice and friendly . 
House keeping could not have been more helpful and nice . 
My hubby and I did not want to leave .
One corner across the street from us was Morton’s steakhouse best steak I have had in a long time .
Across the street at the other corner was O’Hara’s pub great for bar food and good drinks . 
I highly recommend this hotel you well not regret it .

title: Oltre le aspettative
text:
Abbiamo alloggiato in questa struttura a metà marzo 2023 e ha soddisfatto pienamente ogni nostra aspettativa.
Posizione ottima nel financial district, a pochi passi dal memoriale 11/09 e dalla Freedom tower. Inoltre ben collegato con diverse linee della metro.
Buonissimo rapporto qualità/prezzo con colazione inclusa.
Camere spaziose e pulite, magari farei manutenzione ad alcune camere ( per esempio nella nostra la porta del bagno non si chiudeva bene).
Ottima la possibilità di rifornimento d’acqua alla reception.
Colazione buona, non con ampissima scelta,  ma nel complesso soddisfacente.
Possibilità di deposito bagagli
Ferro da stiro nelle camere

title: Birthday trip
text:
We have stayed there for 4 nights,we came to celebrate my son 30th birthday 
Hotel is good perfect location close to Wall Street, ferry to Statue of Liberty and Brooklyn Bridge. The rooms average but do the job for few nights . Very downside is beds they are double beds but very small double I actually had thinks they gave us room with 2 single beds for 4 ppl.
Big thank you to housekeeping,room clean every day with fresh towels .
Not nice staff to be honest only one lovely and friendly man (tall one ) in front door .
Breakfast included we had what a joke it was OMG.  We have been able to had breakfast only in first dayafter that no chance,around 9am there was nothing left and they not bring anything else.

title: They don’t refund your money eventhough it is fully refundable!!!
text: Booked this hotel in January 27th through agoda with fully refundable rate. The next day I cancelled the booking. Nevertheless they have charged the amount onto my credit card. I emailed the hotel and requested for my refund. They told me to wait for 30 business days. It has been more than this. I wrote back 3 more times to the hotel asking why is the refund taking so long. They just told me that the refund request has been escalated but did not tell me when I shall expect to receive it and the reason for the delay. Apparently this has happened to many people. VERY VERY BAD EXPERIENCE. PLEASE BEWARE. NEVER BOOK THROUGH THIS HOTEL GROUP. UP UNTIL TODAY I HAVE YET TO RECEIVE MY REFUND!!!

title: No customer Relationship
text: I made a reservation for February 9 to 12 and I canceled on January 30 and I never received a refund. I have no contact from the hotel and nobody can handle my claim by phone. The Custer relationship is horrible

title: Nice Spring break stay
text:
I was reading all the reviews, and I was getting second thoughts as it was mixed reviews. However, everyone has different opinions, but I can tell you hands down, the staff was very friendly and helpful. They were accommodating, always smiling- they were dancing and singing to the music that was playing. Not once did we feel like we were an inconvenience. The lobby was beautiful- modern decor! The view we had of the freedom tower was incredible. Yes, they need some touch ups with the paint in the bathroom- big deal. I have been to other places with worse things to do. One thing I do have to say is the shower window facing the beds were a little awkward. I had to shower in the dark so the boys won’t me- maybe frost the glass for privacy. 
The restaurant for breakfast skinos is so beautifully decorated. The breakfast- continental was perfect for us. Nice bagel with cream cheese, croissants fruits, yogurt. Perfect! 
We can’t wait to come back again! Thank you

title: Nice hotel for the price and location is perfect
text:
Pros: 
Comfy bed and pillows
Nice & helpful staff
Very quiet neighborhood
Well equipped with iron, ironing board, hair dryer, USB slots, plugs
Nice window seat to chill 

Main Pro: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION
Within a 2-5ish min walk of 4 train stations
15ish min walk to Battery Park, Roosevelt Park, East River, Hudson River
Amazing food within walking distance - The Tin Bldg (a foodie heaven), Indian, Irish, Uzbekistan/Kazakhstan, Steak, American, Mexican, Greek
20min train ride to Times Square & Broadway
Across the street from WTC & Oculus
7-11 & Duane Reed (Walgreens) super short walk
Wall St is a few blocks 

Cons
No DND marker for door
Super heavy pocket bathroom door that could break a hand if closing wrong way
No fart fan in bathroom
If you're a make-up wearer the bathroom lighting is horrible 

Side con: if you have a sweet tooth and want dessert DO NOT get it from Skinos downstairs. Threw away 2 barely eaten desserts cause they were awful. Instead walk around the corner to Zaza.

title: Great location with a modern vibe
text: Great location within a 2 min walk to the Wtc cortland subway station which can get you almost anywhere. The hotel room was modern and nice with everything you would expect from a hotel room. Only slight negative was the the privacy in the bathroom(no lock on the door and shower was abutted to opec glass with a clear strip so if you were using the toilet or the shower you could almost perfectly be seen by someone on the bed) We stayed on the 19th floor which was 2 quick elevator rides, one bonus about the floor was the view of the world trade centre and the night view of the city lights which were insane. Continental breakfast wasn’t great, there was a choice if coffee, tea, bananas, apples and muffins, so we opted to go out for breakfast everyday.

title: Avoid This At All Cost
text: I have a booking that I cancelled within the free cancellation period but until now they have not processed the refund. It’s been 3 weeks already and they are ignoring my messages. I tried to call but the receptionist keeps saying she doesn’t know anything about it. I was instead advised to email them so their refunds team can investigate.

title: Very good rooms poor service
text:
I stayed at the hotel for 7 nights . The rooms are clean and well decorated with great view of World Trade Center. The down side are the mini bar was empty and no complimentary water at all . If you need water wether cold or hot you have to go to the lobby and take it from a machine . The front desk is awful specially at night i called them several times no one answer i called from my cellphone still no answer .and it happened again .The young girl jeanmarie also is not friendly and helpful at all . People work in the morning are much much better and friendly.
Also the complimentary breakfast is also a problem you have to go to the first level the bar near the entrance always bad smells and the way they put foods on the counter looks they are feeding poor people .the atmosphere was really bad . I needed to print something which was an emergency the printer didn’t work so i told the reception please try and let me know . She didn’t even call me . And i tried from the building next door.
Overall , i could say the room is very good but the service is really poor .

title: Great location
text: Great location and the room was clean.  Free Wifi was great.  Staff was super nice!  I wish there had been vending and room service, but there were enough convenience stores and restaurants nearby to make up for it.

title: Trop bien placé !!
text: Pour notre huitième séjour,nous avons séjourné au financial district,et qu'elle vue!! Chambre au 22 ème étage,très calme. Bien équipée, ménage tous les jours : rien à dire ! Café et thé à volonté de 7 à 11h au 2 ème étage,et bagagerie disponible ! Top

title: Great Hotel!
text:
We all enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Staff were so friendly and attentive. Hotel had Christmas decorations up which were very pretty. Free coffee on 2nd floor till 11am. A special thank you to the lovely Victor who helped two struggling English ladies with their bags and the lady who booked us in and thought we were sisters. 
Thanks for a great stay!

title: Turism
text:
Excep few people very friendly trying to help you really very bad the check-in after I payied a lot of money for 3 nights just because a problem with my credit card they almost denied my accommodations if somebody would
Pay for me the account of 75 American dollars when I could pay by cash.... the director I think he doesn’t even care about.... very noise the rooms the cleaning is ok... many problems with the lift... really to much expensive for what they give even not breakfast ... now I know a bit better the very expensive New York you pay just the name

title: Good for the price
text: I was on the hunt for the right balance of price to amenities in the financial district, and I found it at The Washington. The rooms are clean, check-in was crisp. It’s in the running to be my new regular spot in NYC.

title: Lost the W Vibe
text:
Pros:
Great location, close to 911 Memorial and museum, Battery Park, One World, Oculus, shopping.
Great views. High floors have awesome views of 911 Memorial and One World.
Friendly staff, only if you can find someone to help you
Prices reasonable by NYC standards, about 100 dollars less than anything around.
Comfortable beds. 
Good air conditioning/heating. 
Large rooms by NYC standards.

Cons:
Limited staff. No valet, no bell person,no concierge, minimal front desk staff. No front desk staff early in the morning.
No rooftop bar; don’t let the booking sites fool you. 
There is a bar in the lobby, but no bartender and no liquor of any kind. 
Worn W Hotel vibe throughout the hotel, dirty lobby carpets, worn lobby furniture. 
Elevators constantly breaking down, long waits, and loud squeals when they open and close. 
Room decor ok, but definitely signs of wear on the walls, floors, doors, and bathrooms. 
Lots of short dark hairs in shower, definitely not mine (automatic one star deduction)

359/200 minimum

title: Amazing view
text: The staff was very nice and so helpful with accommodating us. We wanted to switch rooms and they did their best to do so. Gave us a perfect view room. The hotel is very impressive and cool looking. Location is perfect.

title: great place to stay
text: this was a welcome change having previously stayed in the Times Sq area for 3 nights.  It was quiet and very clean, function and not over fussy.  Staff were very helpful and the area generally was lovely and less crowded.  We walked a lot whilst in NY and this hotel lent itself nicely to great restaurants and the southern part of the island, could recommend

title: Great Staff. Great Location.
text:
Wonderful place. 
Nice sized, clean rooms. 
Great bar, desk and housekeeping staff. 
Loved the location. Walked everywhere!
We had a beautiful view of Tge Freedom Tower. 

Lower Manhattan is the place to visit. 
Molto Bene!

title: Meh. Fine for the price.
text: The room was fine. It used to be nice. But they’ve let the whole place go. For the price, it was fine. Only one elevator working; they clearly don’t care. Most people buying through Hotwire or similar. The elevator issue is just not acceptable. Will not come again. Great location if this is the area you want.

title: Super Hotel direkt am One World Trade Center
text: Ein wirklich gutes und bezahlbares Hotel, direkt am One Word Trade Center. Sauber, gute Zimmer und freundliches Personal! Das Hotel hat einen direkten Blick auf das ONC und liegt in unmittelbarer Nähe zur Metrro.

title: High Expectations, below average experience!
text: The location of the hotel is awesome and the concept is innovative, but the experience is a completely different thing. The rooms were small, low quality mattresses, dirty bathrooms, lack of customer service, you can feel a weird bad vibe in the staff and the people that stays in the hotel. This is not a “4 stars hotel”

title: ABOVE and BEYOND
text:
We were staying in a Suite Room! Great Views and amazing room! Bed And living room is amazing!!! For sure will come back again and will recommend it to my friends and relatives👏🏻
The location is close to shopping and to the memorable place of World Trade Center and an amazing One Observatory !

title: Love NYC!
text: Great location, had a great view of the 9/11 Memorial and WT1. Walked to the bars, and restaurants in the financial district as well as the Hudson to see the Statue of Liberty and to Trinity Church. Very close to the Rector Street subway also. They let me check in early and check out late at no additional cost. Overall a great experience and I would love to stay there again. Really couldn’t beat the view, and the window opens up about 5 inches so you can hear the sounds of the city. There was a safe in the room also, which was awesome to have!

title: Glad I picked this place. What's with the negative reviews?
text:
I think the negative reviews must be older as there is a LOT to like about this hotel

The Good:
- Staff is very helpful 
- Checkin process was fast
- Awesome location next to Freedom tower, Brookfield Place, Pumphouse, water front view across the Hudson of Jersey City and statue of liberty
- Clean well lit room
- Gym was clean and decent equipment
- AC that actually works
- EZ access to multiple subway stations
- Quiet room. Maybe I just got lucky with lack of neighbors

The  Negative:
- You always need to switch elevators going down or up to your room
- toilet makes a loud dying animal sound when you flush

The last two are pretty minor all considering. Give this place a try.

title: Good stay
text: Nice Vibe. Quality rooms. Great staff. But of course you can hear everything outside your room door and only 1 out of 3 elevators were working so the wait to just go to the main lobby was about 15mins.

title: Good experience
text: So at first I kinda hesitated to book this hotel after looking at a few reviews but I'm glad I stood here  The location of the hotel is in the perfect area. Elevators worked perfect the room was clean and Makia was very helpful with everything and kind. I will be coming back to visit.

title: Great place to stay
text: Staff was awesome and accommodating, room was very comfortable with an awesome view and very close to everyth8ng. Room cleaning service was on point every day. My only critique would be better lighting in the hallways and bathroom and the hallways could use a bit of updating. Other than that we would totally stay there again.

title: Beautiful and Great Location
text: The Washington is located close to the 911 Memorial and pretty convenient if you want to go around Manhattan or take the boat to Staten Island or the Statue of Liberty. Hotel is also a walking distance to Brooklyn Bridge. hotel is also a walking distance to Brooklyn Bridge. The room amenities were great. The Molton Brown lotion provided by the hotel gets our thumps up. Skinos restaurant was also good.

title: CARINO MA ATTENZIONE ALLA CARTA DI CREDITO
text: Hotel carino , ma attenzione alla carta di credito. Senza alcun avviso e ricevuta, al rientro in Italia ci accorgiamo di una trattenuta di 321 dollari dalla cauzione. Dopo molti  tentativi di metterci in contatto con reception e direttore, finalmente rispondono, ammettendo l'errore e promettendo la restituzione della somma. Peccato che il giorno dopo  " L' ERRORE "si trasforma in una lista di tasse e " destination fee" , nuova costosa tassa di cui l'hotel non ci aveva messo al corrente. Avendo subito disservizi come lavandino del bagno otturato, allarme antincendio della stanza in tilt e ascensori guasti  una mattina, questo comportamento non lo trovo corretto da parte di una struttura dj questo tipo.

title: Excelente hotel!
text:
En hotel  tiene una vista muy buena de  la ciudad. 
Las habitaciones son espaciosas con un  buen colchón. Todo muy limpio.
No tiene calentador de agua. Eso el algo negativo. Para preparar un té o un café estando ahí. 
Tiene varias cajoneras y roperos par guardar ropa. Plancha y tablero de planchar.

title: W become flop pad
text: No services. Minimal staff. Abandoned lounge and amenities. Not a bottle of water on the property but you can get a tiny plastic cup of water in the lobby. Dirty rooms stripped to only the necessities. If you want a cheap place to stay that used to be a W, you found it. If you want a welcoming hotel, look elsewhere.

title: Such a wonderful find
text: I was traveling for work and landed on this place because it was within my cooperate travel budget. But it  turned out to be SO MUCH MORE THAN AFFORADABLE. Friendly staff, clean, gorgeous rooms. Perfect location to Battery Park and the 911 memorial. I ate at the hotel bar, Skinos, the food was delicious. I mean come on, the hits just kept playing here!. This is my go to place from now on when  I Travel to New York. And you need to make it yours too.

title: Hotel magnifico
text:
Ho prenotato questo albergo su booking dove avevo letto recensioni ottime. Non capisco davvero come su TripAdvisor siano così basse. Resta un mistero! 
Innanzitutto la posizione è fantastica: downtown è un quartiere tranquillo, pulito e molto sorvegliato per via della vicinanza con ground zero (c'è sempre polizia). Si trova di fronte al sito delle torri gemelle, a due passi da wall street, al world trade center, parecchi negozi come H&M, negozi di souvenir, Louis Vuitton, Gucci, e a due passi dalla zona in cui si prendono i traghetti per la statua della libertà ed Ellis island. Ci sono diversi ristoranti (consiglio Bill's burger fra tutti proprio all'angolo o il pub Hoara), posti buonissimi in cui fare colazione come dunking donuts e Starbucks. La vista dalla camera è indescrivibile (allego foto per farvi capire ma dal vivo rende molto di più)... Personale gentile, al nostro arrivo ci hanno omaggiato con un drink da consumare al bar che si trova accanto. Al quinto piano, dove si trova la reception, troverete un distributore di acqua: per noi è stato molto utile, oltre che per la sera, anche per riempire le bottigliette prima di uscire. Letti comodissimi, ferro e asse da stiro, frigorifero e phon, oltre che tutti i tipi di sapone, bagnoschiuma, shampoo e crema per il corpo. Tornassi a NY tornerei senza alcun dubbio al Washington hotel. Ci siamo sentiti davvero a casa. 
Grazie!!!

title: I Would NOT Stay Here Again
text:
The room we stayed in (1109) fell below my expectations, and they weren't very high to begin with. There was a huge spot on the wall that had peeling paint. There were dirty handprints on the bedroom and bathroom walls. Upon taking a shower, I realized that someone's hair was tangled in the shower head, and strands of hair throughout the rest of the bathroom. There were no washcloths in the bathroom. The iron and ironing board had a purple gooey like residue (probably from a previous burn) that transferred onto my clothes. Although these issues made my stay very uncomfortable, I tried to look past them because I was only staying there for one night. 

On the day of my departure, the room was without hot water for hours, and I needed to leave for a meeting. I expressed the issue of the hot water to staff several times and I don't feel like they acted fast enough to assist, given that I had somewhere to be. They kept saying the hot water was back, but that wasn’t the case for my room, so I asked for another room to shower in. The manager finally came an hour after my first complaint, which was well after checkout time, offering to take me to the 20th floor. At that point the hot water was starting to come back, and I needed to leave, so I didn’t have time to move to a different room. She took 50% off the room rate. 

I think this hotel uses pictures of their lobby to sell rooms, but there is nothing pleasing to the eye once you are beyond that point. The room I stayed in was very small. I always hear people say New York City hotel rooms are small, but I’ve stayed in spacious rooms in the city plenty of times. The hallways are very dark and very dated. Not to mention, all the conversations and noises we could hear coming from other rooms. I will not stay at this hotel again, and will not recommend it to family and friends.

title: Holiday in NYC
text: Excellent location, near subway, World Trade Centre and Occulus centre. Rooms were fab with great views of New York. The reception area is unusual and there’s no bar or coffee dock but there are plenty of seats and a water fountain. The terrace was open at this level and I saw people bring food snd drinks out that they had purchased elsewhere.  My husband availed of the complementary coffee on floor 2  There is a sign at ground level stating reception is on 5th floor (Although having read the reviews I knew this!) We had breakfast in some of the many diners nearby - we would particularly recommend the stage door diner. All in all we would recommend this hotel to others.

title: Excellent location, Friendly staff and amazing views for a value price
text:
Wow! Where to start, after reading so many mixed reviews I had low expectations. This hotel exceeded them all! The view from our deluxe double 10th floor was amazing! The beds and shower were so comfy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is right in the middle of any subway line you need and close to the seaport areas for Ferrys and things. 
My only slight disappointment was that our fridge never got as cold as it should. It did “cool” our drinks barely but not safe to store leftovers in. A microwave would be nice too but really not necessary. 
Overall I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a safe and convenient place to stay while on business or just visiting NYC! This comes from a family that travels all the time. We stayed 7nights.

title: At best a low end 3-star hotel
text:
On arrival, after a 12h travel, we were greeted by no one. After some looking around, I found the entrance and the fifth floor of a building of this hotel. It was around 3pm afternoon.

Elevator stopped and I looked around at what seemed to be a hotel lobby. Dark, entrance, just like the everlasting mood of the receptionists of this hotel.

I awkwardly moved to the end of the room where there was one person behind the counter. 

No hi, no welcome, no are you here for the checking?, no I'll be with you in a moment, no eye contact. Just deafening silence. 

I checked in, they added the usual surcharge crap I always get in the states, and got 2 complimentary drinks (beer, wine, cocktails) vouchers for the restaurant. View from the room is a lie. Balcony is a lie. Usually, you would expect hotels to angle their pictures a bit and add the lights, but this is pushed to a point where it's annoying. 

The receptionist informs me that I can choose the only left room on the 8th floor or on the 20th floor “but that's small so it's not really an option”. I disregard the idiotic statement and move on. At this point I should have probably cancelled the whole thing and move to a new hotel, but my fatigue wins the argument.

I get to the restaurant a couple of days later they blew me off and said we only give complimentary beer or wine. What a joke. 

Their rooms are old and rugged, likely they weren't touched (renovated) for the last 20years or so. The shower smells like mold.

General Manager “tries” to get in touch with me via phone call to the room. I get down to the reception, asking if the General Manager Brian is around, the receptionist blows me off and says that she is busy with the other clients at the moment.

GM “tries” calling me again on the last day of the trip. 

The positive things is the older woman that did room service every day and warmly welcomed and said hi. Price should be even cheaper for this level of service, and the location is satisfactory apart from the smell of the neighbourhood.

If I were you I'd pay a bit less and get a three star or a bit more and get a real 4 star hotel instead of risking being treated like I was.

title: This is not the W Downtown
text:
I've had an amazing experience with this hotel and one of its partner websites Traveleuro. Let me explain.

I went to make a reservation for a high-quality hotel downtown, and saw from my search on Google hotels that the W Downtown was available at a decent price.  Trusting from the listing this was actually the W Downtown, I made a reservation.

After making the reservation, I wanted to connect my Marriott awards account to my reservation get points for my stay.  It was then that I found out that the hotel was sold and is fraudulently trading on the W name through the various travel websites where it is listed.

My next thought was, ok, its a boutique now... let me see what the reviews are like under new management and maybe I'll keep the reservation, and boy were the reviews bad as evidenced on this and other review sites.

So I thought, fine, if this is the case, I'm getting a refund as I was sold the hotel room under false pretence.

 I get in touch with Traveleuro (Splitty), they tell me they don't know the hotel changed hands (Sure...) and they have a no cancellation policy, but they'll escalate. I said I'll escalate too if I have to and dispute this charge as my credit card company has a no fraud policy and its an easy win.

From there, the latest is that I get a message from traveleuro/Splitty stating they indeed confirmed with the hotel it changed names and is under new management, but when they asked for an approval from the hotel for a cancellation they denied it (wow).

They are going to, they told me, get in touch with one of their "other travel partners" to see if they can resolve this in my favour. Good for you.

To which I replied I'm not only disputing the charge, but also contacting Marriott (I did) to let them know these companies are trading on the W name fraudulently, and if I don't get a refund, I'll contact AMEX and dispute this charge and post a negative comment on every major travel site.

So the moral of this story is, don't be fooled by this hotel being listed as the W Downtown - it isn't, and based on the review, it's gone way downhill since it was sold.

title: Fuyez
text: La vue est incroyable, mais les chambres sont vétustes ... beaucoup de mobilier abimés, les murs sales, poignée cassée, le lavabo était fendu,  dans le frigo il y avait de la nourriture des client précédent... Le wifi ne fonctionne pas, Le bar n'est pas ouvert, pas plus que la terrasse. La chambre n'étais pas nettoyée tous les jours ( malgré l'écriteaux le demandant ) ENORME déception concernant votre établissement.  L'accueil était en revanche chaleureux est sympathique mais c'est le seul point positif.

title: Pleasant, quiet and a stunning view
text: I liked this hotel for its view and a good location. I missed a lot a water boiler (to make tea) in the room but appreciated for coffee and tea between 7-11 am each day. I liked that there is TV with Netflix ( log in with your own account). Staff is friendly, Molton Brown mini cosmetics are vey nice.

title: UNA MARAVILLA DE HOTEL
text: Una maravilla de hotel tanto las instalaciones como todo el personal. Nosotros fuimos tres, y la habitacion con dos camas grandes y amplia. la limpieza muy buena, la situacion al lado del memorial 11 S. No le pongo cinco estrellas por dos detalles, en la recepcion no hablan casi español solo una recepcionista que hablaba un poquito. y que no te guardan el equipaje el ultimo dia cuando sales del hotel y tu vuelo sale de noche. Por lo de mas extraordinario. Tambien es bueno saber que te cobran 20 dolares diarios por el wifi y otras instalaciones, y es abligatorio.

title: Scam
text:
Me and my sister stayed in this hotel for more than a week. Upon arrival, the procedure at the reception desk was quite messy. Right after I had paid, the system shut down, as we were told by the lady at the desk. After a reset she confirmed the amount was paid and I could see on my bank account that it indeed had been charged. We also paid a resort fee of 25 dollars per night, which seemed a crazy amount to me. The short system shutdown though obviously got things messed up, since two weeks after my return home (!) I was again charged for our stay.
I thought I was dealing with a serious hotel that would correct this mistake, but I've tried to reach out to them several times and until now I haven't received a solution at all. Or, better said: not even a reply to the emails I sent them. 
About the hotel itself: the only positive thing is the location. The complete hotel has kind of a creepy vibe and it smells like marijuana, we even changed rooms because in the first one the smell was unbelievable. Very dark at the reception and in the hallways, two of the three elevators were out of order for a couple of days. 
Definitely not the boutique hotel it claims to be. Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

title: Disappointing and eyebrow-raising.
text:
My partner and I visited at this hotel for a total of 7 nights in late March 2022. I booked this hotel primarily due to the cost, as I had booked it in part with a redemption of air miles so I managed to obtain a drastically reduced price. The hotel’s location and online photo gallery also seemed pretty attractive. Sadly, however, my expectations were not fully met upon arrival.

What I very quickly learned is that The Washington seems to be a fairly young hotel, and occupies the building of the old W Downtown hotel and residences. This is fine - the decor has remained from when it was a W Hotel so the lobby and rooms are decorated to a very modern standard and are kept looking nice. However, everything else surrounding the ethos of a W Hotel is gone: service is non-existent, claimed amenities do not exist anymore, and the hotel is more reminiscent of an apart-hotel. Rather than being the “boutique hotel” that they claim to be, The Washington provides a bed and that is about it. Nonetheless, I provide here a comprehensive review of The Washington, highlighting both the positives and negatives of my stay.

The Washington is in a very attractive location. It’s across the street from the World Trade Centre, and we had an outstanding view of the 9/11 Memorial Pools and the One World Trade Centre/Freedom Tower. It’s only a few minutes away from many local transport connections including the subway and PATH trains over to New Jersey. Local facilities in the area are somewhat limited and expensive, given its proximity to the financial centre of New York - though convenience stores, coffee shops, cafes, and the like are no more than a few minutes away. The building of the hotel itself is a fairly nicely presented skyscraper, still baring the signs of it formerly being a W Hotel and still flying the W flag above the door - which was strange to say the least. It is beginning to look a little rundown, so a good clean of the exterior would not go a miss.

We arrived at The Washington at around 14:00 on the day of our check in. The reception is located on the 5th floor, and there are no staff on the front doors guiding guests to the reception or anybody available to help with luggage. We were able to check in almost immediately, which was much appreciated. I was charged a ridiculously expensive deposit on the room and a $20 per night “resort fee”, the purpose of which I am still confused about. The lady who checked us in was friendly enough, though my positive experience with staff at the hotel stopped at this point. On all of the other occasions when I passed through the lobby or asked reception a question, I was frequently met with a rude member of staff who was typically sat lounging about and on their mobile phone, not even stopping to look at me or greet me. On more than one occasion there was nobody even on the reception but they were rather lounging on the few sofas in reception. It was also notoriously hard to reach the reception and I couldn’t work the in-room phone at all. 

There are three elevators which operate between the ground floor and the reception: these worked well consistently. The other elevators which operate between the reception and guest rooms were not as consistent. On two days we had to use the service elevator as they seemed to be out of service. These elevators are also showing signs of age: one of them has had a panel screwed onto the ceiling, indicating damage, and another is simply very dirty. The service lifts were also unpleasant and generally not a nice experience.

The halls to the guest rooms are incredibly dark. They are decorated nicely enough, but they almost have a sleezy look to them. There are no windows in the halls and I did not particularly enjoy walking around these areas. Many of the guest room doors are also scratched or showing signs of strange damage. 

Our room was located on the 17th floor. I was surprised at the size of it - it was definitely larger than other New York hotels in the area and boasted, as outlined above, a very nice view. The bedroom was cleaned to a high standard. In-room amenities were present, but limited: there was a safe, a mini-fridge, an iron, an unnecessarily large TV and an in-room phone. The TV worked well, though it had limited channels and the Netflix option did not work. I could not manage to work the in-room phone either. 

The bathroom featured a large rainfall shower, sink, and toilet. When we arrived, Molton Brown miniature toiletries were in the bathroom though this was not maintained consistently throughout our stay, as I will outline in a moment. The bathroom was not as clean as I would expect: there was a notable amount of black mould around shower ceiling and tiles, and the toilet seat had been scratched or damaged.

The room that we were provided with had an inter-room connecting door, and as such the noise levels in the room were at times a nuisance and troublesome. The two groups of people who checked into the room next door during our stay were obnoxiously loud, and the thinness of the walls as well as the inter-room connecting door only further amplified this noise. When I complained to the reception, they sent security to the room but were otherwise unwilling to help.

Housekeeping was present in this hotel and I mostly commend the housekeepers. They consistently serviced our room each day, providing us with fresh towels and new toiletries though they were often mismatched and not always Molton Brown as advertised. The room was vacuumed daily. As for the bed linen, these were changed only once during our week long stay. While housekeeping did make our beds, I noticed that the sheets were simply put back onto the bed and not refreshed. The two women who serviced our room throughout the week were friendly, and I commend their service.

The hotel, seeming to cling onto the old W Downton vibe and online photo gallery, claims to provide services that do not exist. There is apparently a terrace on the 5th floor. The outdoor space is indeed there, but it is inaccessible. Similarly, photos show a bar in the reception. The bar is there, but it is dilapidated and unused. Photos indicate that there is a rooftop area with loungers, though these were again not accessible. 

As such, catering was essentially non-existent at the hotel. While there is a bar/restaurant at street level, it did not particularly intrigue me enough to try it and I instead had to venture out for basics even such as breakfast and bottled water.

One final event which gave me a bad impression was that when we checked out, we asked to leave two small bags at the hotel for a few hours until our flight. This was swiftly rejected, claiming initially that it’s because of COVID-19, before the man then simply said there is no storage room. I don’t understand either of these claims. 

As a whole, The Washington could be a lovely hotel. It occupies a nice building in a good area and has inherited W Hotels’ vibe to it. However, the hotel management should decide whether they want to be The Washington - the “boutique hotel” they claim to be - or W Downton 2.0. If they want to maintain W’s vibes, they should therefore also maintain or surpass W’s service. Otherwise, the hotel needs to become a lot more transparent in its advertising and stop claiming to have certain facilities and features that it simply does not. 

I am unsure as to how the hotel claims to be 4.5 stars. I would rate it more a 3 star budget hotel based on its inadequate service. The Washington could indeed be a 4.5 star hotel, but it is nowhere near that level at present.

Since I did not pay a full cash price for this stay, I am not as bitter as I otherwise would be. Nonetheless, I still do not think that the air miles that I redeemed, the cash surplus, the deposit, and the resort fee were justified in cost. I am somewhat resentful of how much I ended up paying for this room, as I know that I could have gotten much better service from another nearby hotel for roughly the same cost.

At present, I would not recommend this hotel and I would not return to it. That being said, I hope that the hotel will increase its standards in due course.

title: SUPER BAD EXPERIENCE
text:
Very upset with this hotel I get there late on check in when I get there the first room smell like marijuana them the concierge transfer me to other room them on the second room tv was not working at all them I call gets services them he inform me the IT will be working on reset the room but that was not the case I wait for 2 hours them I went down stairs to speak the concierge she was very sorry them she upgrade me to other room. 

A Manager call on on the morning to apoligieze them he make the statement sorry we will refund you one day for all this I was very upset because I move my self from two different rooms and I honestly don't recommended this hotel at all even do concierge over night she was adorable and sweet 

The agency who I I make a reservation inform me  that was never issue a refund at all. 

VERY LACK OF COMMITMENT FROM THIS HOTEL.

title: Recycled W
text: This is the old W.  Whoever bought it did not make edits, so it has the W feel, but it needs maintenance. My room was clean, but needed some TLC. Thin walls. I heard my neighbor’s alarm go off and a lot of elevator dinging (my room was a couple rooms down). 20$ resort fee for a couple waters. Staff was helpful and pleasant. It’s near the world trade so I would return when I have to be down there although not enthusiastically.

title: Terrible
text: We had to go to the front desk if we needed towels, our room to be serviced, or anything else.  Our room was covered in dust, the bathroom had hair and some dried fluid (who knows what) on the toilet and sink. The fridge had black mold in it. The shower had not been cleaned. We had to use the service elevator during our 5 day stay. We wanted to leave our bags the day we checked out since we had a later flight, but they couldn’t accommodate us. It’s weird because they said it was because of Covid, but we stayed at the Hotel right across the street in July of this year and they were fully staffed, cleaned our rooms, brought us towels and let us leave our bags. I believe the owner is taking advantage of the staff and Covid situation here. They seem overworked and underpaid. I expect so much more from a hotel with this rating. They even charged us a resort fee with no amenities. Our floor smelled of smoke for half of our stay. Do yourself a favor and find somewhere else to stay. To the owner, hire some bellman and more housekeeping staff. Fix your phones.

title: Zimmer mit Ausblick
text: Sind als Familie zu viert für 3 Nächte in dem Hotel gewesen. Beim Einchecken hat alles super geklappt. Die Leute waren sehr freundlich und hilfsbewusst. Hatten unser Zimmer im 15 Stock mit einem atemberaubenden Blick auf Ground Zero und das World Trade Center. Das Zimmer war für New Yorker Verhältnisse groß. Es war sauber und wurde jeden Tag gemacht, was leider für New York nicht selbstverständlich ist. Weil wir am Abreisetag das Gepäck wegen COVID nicht deponieren konnten durften wir bis um 16:00 auf dem Zimmer bleiben. Wir können das Hotel nur empfehlen.
